 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>

                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->

                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1164846: Security: ImageFetchTabHelper::GetImageDataByJs allows child frames to inject scripts into parent (UXSS)
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1164846: Security: ImageFetchTabHelper::GetImageDataByJs allows child frames to inject scripts into parent (UXSS)
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        Description #1 by nishi...@gmail.com (Jan 11, 2021)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The javascript generated by ImageFetchTabHelper::GetImageDataByJs is unsafely created using the following format string.<span class="line"><!---->The javascript generated by ImageFetchTabHelper::GetImageDataByJs is unsafely created using the following format string.<!----></span><br><br>std::string js =<span class="line"><!---->std::string js =<!----></span><br>    base::StringPrintf("__gCrWeb.imageFetch.getImageData(%d, '%s')", call_id_,<span class="line"><!---->    base::StringPrintf("__gCrWeb.imageFetch.getImageData(%d, '%s')", call_id_,<!----></span><br>                       url.spec().c_str());<span class="line"><!---->                       url.spec().c_str());<!----></span><br>web_state_->ExecuteJavaScript(base::UTF8ToUTF16(js));<span class="line"><!---->web_state_-&gt;ExecuteJavaScript(base::UTF8ToUTF16(js));<!----></span><br><br>The `url.spec().c_str()` parameter is an image URL given from web content directly.<span class="line"><!---->The `url.spec().c_str()` parameter is an image URL given from web content directly.<!----></span><br>If an image URL containing a script, e.g., `/'alert(1)+'.png`, is downloaded through "Save Image" in a child frame, ImageFetchTabHelper injects crafted JavaScript code into the parent frame. That triggers UXSS in the parent frame.<span class="line"><!---->If an image URL containing a script, e.g., `/'alert(1)+'.png`, is downloaded through "Save Image" in a child frame, ImageFetchTabHelper injects crafted JavaScript code into the parent frame. That triggers UXSS in the parent frame.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 88.0.4324.69+beta<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 88.0.4324.69+beta<!----></span><br>Operating System: iPhone 8 Simulator with iOS 14.3<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: iPhone 8 Simulator with iOS 14.3<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>The page for testing is below.<span class="line"><!---->The page for testing is below.<!----></span><br>https://alice.csrf.jp/2021/chromium_ios/uxss1/parent.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alice.csrf.jp/2021/chromium_ios/uxss1/parent.html"><!---->https://alice.csrf.jp/2021/chromium_ios/uxss1/parent.html<!----></a><br><br>In this page, parent frame is a victim hosted by alice.csrf.jp, that page is protected by CSP for prohibitting script execution.<span class="line"><!---->In this page, parent frame is a victim hosted by alice.csrf.jp, that page is protected by CSP for prohibitting script execution.<!----></span><br>Its child frame is Evil hosted by evil.csrf.jp, that frame has an <img> tag to `/uxss'+alert('UXSS!:'+document.domain)+'.png`.<span class="line"><!---->Its child frame is Evil hosted by evil.csrf.jp, that frame has an &lt;img&gt; tag to `/uxss'+alert('UXSS!:'+document.domain)+'.png`.<!----></span><br>When you tap the image and choose "Save image" or "Copy image", UXSS is triggered on the parent victim page.<span class="line"><!---->When you tap the image and choose "Save image" or "Copy image", UXSS is triggered on the parent victim page.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Muneaki Nishimura (nishimunea)<span class="line"><!---->Muneaki Nishimura (nishimunea)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Note that this security bugs reproduce on Chromium for iOS only.<span class="line"><!---->Note that this security bugs reproduce on Chromium for iOS only.<!----></span><br>The Objective-C source code that causes the problem is below.<span class="line"><!---->The Objective-C source code that causes the problem is below.<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ios/chrome/browser/web/image_fetch_tab_helper.mm;l=140<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ios/chrome/browser/web/image_fetch_tab_helper.mm;l=140"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ios/chrome/browser/web/image_fetch_tab_helper.mm;l=140<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        This is a PoC code for the relevant issue I commented in #9.<span class="line"><!---->This is a PoC code for the relevant issue I commented in #9.<!----></span><br>https://evil.csrf.jp/2021/chromium_ios/cross-origin-url-leak1/parent.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://evil.csrf.jp/2021/chromium_ios/cross-origin-url-leak1/parent.html"><!---->https://evil.csrf.jp/2021/chromium_ios/cross-origin-url-leak1/parent.html<!----></a><br><br>Here, the parent frame is Attacker (evil.csrf.jp) and the child frame is the Target (alice.csrf.jp).<span class="line"><!---->Here, the parent frame is Attacker (evil.csrf.jp) and the child frame is the Target (alice.csrf.jp).<!----></span><br>The parent frame overrides the built-in function `__gCrWeb.imageFetch.getImageData` by its page script.<span class="line"><!---->The parent frame overrides the built-in function `__gCrWeb.imageFetch.getImageData` by its page script.<!----></span><br>If you save an image in the child frame (Target), that URL is stolen by the overridden function in the parent frame (Attacker).<span class="line"><!---->If you save an image in the child frame (Target), that URL is stolen by the overridden function in the parent frame (Attacker).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 13, 2021, 1:53 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: ImageFetchTabHelper::GetImageDataByJs allows child frames to inject scripts into parent (UXSS) and leaks child URL.
          (was: Security: ImageFetchTabHelper::GetImageDataByJs allows child frames to inject scripts into parent (UXSS).)
          <br>
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Started)
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          eugen...@chromium.org marq@chromium.org justincohen@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: ImageFetchTabHelper::GetImageDataByJs allows child frames to inject scripts into parent (UXSS) and leaks child URL.
          (was: Security: ImageFetchTabHelper::GetImageDataByJs allows child frames to inject scripts into parent (UXSS).)
          <br>

        I am ok with a single bug for now, at least until we figure out how to proceed with fixing this. (I'll update the summary.)<span class="line"><!---->I am ok with a single bug for now, at least until we figure out how to proceed with fixing this. (I'll update the summary.)<!----></span><br><br>This feature was designed in<span class="line"><!---->This feature was designed in<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>go/ios-chrome-copy-image<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/ios-chrome-copy-image"><!---->go/ios-chrome-copy-image<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> but I wasn't very involved with it. I'm adding some of the folks who were.<span class="line"><!----> but I wasn't very involved with it. I'm adding some of the folks who were.<!----></span><br><br>Eugene, Mark, Justin: As reviewers of the "Copy Image" feature, how should we handle this case. It sounds like we specifically wanted to try to use the WebView to download the image, but we are using the main frame to download an image which could be from a child frame.<span class="line"><!---->Eugene, Mark, Justin: As reviewers of the "Copy Image" feature, how should we handle this case. It sounds like we specifically wanted to try to use the WebView to download the image, but we are using the main frame to download an image which could be from a child frame.<!----></span><br><br>I can think of a few mitigations:<span class="line"><!---->I can think of a few mitigations:<!----></span><br>1. Fix/sanitize the URL before handing it to the main frame. I am not sure if this is trivial or not.<span class="line"><!---->1. Fix/sanitize the URL before handing it to the main frame. I am not sure if this is trivial or not.<!----></span><br>2. Download the image in the same WebFrame which the element exists. This would require some feature changes as the WebFrame isn't available right now to ImageFetchTabHelper.<span class="line"><!---->2. Download the image in the same WebFrame which the element exists. This would require some feature changes as the WebFrame isn't available right now to ImageFetchTabHelper.<!----></span><br>3. Remove this download method. There are still two other ways to get the image - draw it into a canvas or download outside of WKWebView.<span class="line"><!---->3. Remove this download method. There are still two other ways to get the image - draw it into a canvas or download outside of WKWebView.<!----></span><br>4. Send the image data with the initial context menu element details instead of the URL. There is already a 100ms timeout since this method is only meant to retrieve the image from cache, not actually re-download so I think this wouldn't create any noticeable delay, but would increase the size of the context menu payload for images significantly and it gets called a lot (on every tap/scroll down).<span class="line"><!---->4. Send the image data with the initial context menu element details instead of the URL. There is already a 100ms timeout since this method is only meant to retrieve the image from cache, not actually re-download so I think this wouldn't create any noticeable delay, but would increase the size of the context menu payload for images significantly and it gets called a lot (on every tap/scroll down).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I uploaded a CL is escape the URL here:<span class="line"><!---->I uploaded a CL is escape the URL here:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/2628024<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2628024"><!---->crrev.com/c/2628024<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> This won't prevent the leaking of the URL. Migrating image fetch JS to isolated worlds would mitigate the leaking of the URL, but running the JS within the same frame as the image (instead of just the same WebView) would be even better.<span class="line"><!----> This won't prevent the leaking of the URL. Migrating image fetch JS to isolated worlds would mitigate the leaking of the URL, but running the JS within the same frame as the image (instead of just the same WebView) would be even better.<!----></span><br><br>I suggest we proceed in this way:<span class="line"><!---->I suggest we proceed in this way:<!----></span><br>- Land URL escaping CL<span class="line"><!---->- Land URL escaping CL<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/crrev.com/c/2628024<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/crrev.com/c/2628024"><!---->crrev.com/crrev.com/c/2628024<!----></a> and merge to M89<span class="line"><!----> and merge to M89<!----></span><br>- Migrate image_fetch.js to isolated world, target M90<span class="line"><!---->- Migrate image_fetch.js to isolated world, target M90<!----></span><br>- Then optionally (but it will improve the success of fetching images via canvas drawing or cache hits) update code to call getImageData on the WebFrame which the image resides in. The WebFrame id is returned with the context menu message, but the WebFrame is not currently piped through the context menu action sheet to the ImageFetch code.<span class="line"><!---->- Then optionally (but it will improve the success of fetching images via canvas drawing or cache hits) update code to call getImageData on the WebFrame which the image resides in. The WebFrame id is returned with the context menu message, but the WebFrame is not currently piped through the context menu action sheet to the ImageFetch code.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          margin: 0;

        }

        mr-edit-issue {

        }
      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        Convert issue to new template structure<h3 class="medium-heading">Convert issue to new template structure</h3>
        
          
            Pick a template: <label for="templateInput">Pick a template: </label>
            
              --Please choose a project template--<option value="">--Please choose a project template--</option>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }

            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;

 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }

 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;

    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {

  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);

  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {

      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;

          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1164846: Security: ImageFetchTabHelper::GetImageDataByJs allows child frames to inject scripts into parent (UXSS)
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1164846: Security: ImageFetchTabHelper::GetImageDataByJs allows child frames to inject scripts into parent (UXSS)
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        Description #1 by nishi...@gmail.com (Jan 11, 2021)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The javascript generated by ImageFetchTabHelper::GetImageDataByJs is unsafely created using the following format string.<span class="line"><!---->The javascript generated by ImageFetchTabHelper::GetImageDataByJs is unsafely created using the following format string.<!----></span><br><br>std::string js =<span class="line"><!---->std::string js =<!----></span><br>    base::StringPrintf("__gCrWeb.imageFetch.getImageData(%d, '%s')", call_id_,<span class="line"><!---->    base::StringPrintf("__gCrWeb.imageFetch.getImageData(%d, '%s')", call_id_,<!----></span><br>                       url.spec().c_str());<span class="line"><!---->                       url.spec().c_str());<!----></span><br>web_state_->ExecuteJavaScript(base::UTF8ToUTF16(js));<span class="line"><!---->web_state_-&gt;ExecuteJavaScript(base::UTF8ToUTF16(js));<!----></span><br><br>The `url.spec().c_str()` parameter is an image URL given from web content directly.<span class="line"><!---->The `url.spec().c_str()` parameter is an image URL given from web content directly.<!----></span><br>If an image URL containing a script, e.g., `/'alert(1)+'.png`, is downloaded through "Save Image" in a child frame, ImageFetchTabHelper injects crafted JavaScript code into the parent frame. That triggers UXSS in the parent frame.<span class="line"><!---->If an image URL containing a script, e.g., `/'alert(1)+'.png`, is downloaded through "Save Image" in a child frame, ImageFetchTabHelper injects crafted JavaScript code into the parent frame. That triggers UXSS in the parent frame.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 88.0.4324.69+beta<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 88.0.4324.69+beta<!----></span><br>Operating System: iPhone 8 Simulator with iOS 14.3<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: iPhone 8 Simulator with iOS 14.3<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>The page for testing is below.<span class="line"><!---->The page for testing is below.<!----></span><br>https://alice.csrf.jp/2021/chromium_ios/uxss1/parent.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://alice.csrf.jp/2021/chromium_ios/uxss1/parent.html"><!---->https://alice.csrf.jp/2021/chromium_ios/uxss1/parent.html<!----></a><br><br>In this page, parent frame is a victim hosted by alice.csrf.jp, that page is protected by CSP for prohibitting script execution.<span class="line"><!---->In this page, parent frame is a victim hosted by alice.csrf.jp, that page is protected by CSP for prohibitting script execution.<!----></span><br>Its child frame is Evil hosted by evil.csrf.jp, that frame has an <img> tag to `/uxss'+alert('UXSS!:'+document.domain)+'.png`.<span class="line"><!---->Its child frame is Evil hosted by evil.csrf.jp, that frame has an &lt;img&gt; tag to `/uxss'+alert('UXSS!:'+document.domain)+'.png`.<!----></span><br>When you tap the image and choose "Save image" or "Copy image", UXSS is triggered on the parent victim page.<span class="line"><!---->When you tap the image and choose "Save image" or "Copy image", UXSS is triggered on the parent victim page.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Muneaki Nishimura (nishimunea)<span class="line"><!---->Muneaki Nishimura (nishimunea)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Note that this security bugs reproduce on Chromium for iOS only.<span class="line"><!---->Note that this security bugs reproduce on Chromium for iOS only.<!----></span><br>The Objective-C source code that causes the problem is below.<span class="line"><!---->The Objective-C source code that causes the problem is below.<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ios/chrome/browser/web/image_fetch_tab_helper.mm;l=140<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ios/chrome/browser/web/image_fetch_tab_helper.mm;l=140"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ios/chrome/browser/web/image_fetch_tab_helper.mm;l=140<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        This is a PoC code for the relevant issue I commented in #9.<span class="line"><!---->This is a PoC code for the relevant issue I commented in #9.<!----></span><br>https://evil.csrf.jp/2021/chromium_ios/cross-origin-url-leak1/parent.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://evil.csrf.jp/2021/chromium_ios/cross-origin-url-leak1/parent.html"><!---->https://evil.csrf.jp/2021/chromium_ios/cross-origin-url-leak1/parent.html<!----></a><br><br>Here, the parent frame is Attacker (evil.csrf.jp) and the child frame is the Target (alice.csrf.jp).<span class="line"><!---->Here, the parent frame is Attacker (evil.csrf.jp) and the child frame is the Target (alice.csrf.jp).<!----></span><br>The parent frame overrides the built-in function `__gCrWeb.imageFetch.getImageData` by its page script.<span class="line"><!---->The parent frame overrides the built-in function `__gCrWeb.imageFetch.getImageData` by its page script.<!----></span><br>If you save an image in the child frame (Target), that URL is stolen by the overridden function in the parent frame (Attacker).<span class="line"><!---->If you save an image in the child frame (Target), that URL is stolen by the overridden function in the parent frame (Attacker).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 13, 2021, 1:53 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: ImageFetchTabHelper::GetImageDataByJs allows child frames to inject scripts into parent (UXSS) and leaks child URL.
          (was: Security: ImageFetchTabHelper::GetImageDataByJs allows child frames to inject scripts into parent (UXSS).)
          <br>
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Started)
          <br>
        
          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          eugen...@chromium.org marq@chromium.org justincohen@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          Security: ImageFetchTabHelper::GetImageDataByJs allows child frames to inject scripts into parent (UXSS) and leaks child URL.
          (was: Security: ImageFetchTabHelper::GetImageDataByJs allows child frames to inject scripts into parent (UXSS).)
          <br>

        I am ok with a single bug for now, at least until we figure out how to proceed with fixing this. (I'll update the summary.)<span class="line"><!---->I am ok with a single bug for now, at least until we figure out how to proceed with fixing this. (I'll update the summary.)<!----></span><br><br>This feature was designed in<span class="line"><!---->This feature was designed in<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>go/ios-chrome-copy-image<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://go/ios-chrome-copy-image"><!---->go/ios-chrome-copy-image<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> but I wasn't very involved with it. I'm adding some of the folks who were.<span class="line"><!----> but I wasn't very involved with it. I'm adding some of the folks who were.<!----></span><br><br>Eugene, Mark, Justin: As reviewers of the "Copy Image" feature, how should we handle this case. It sounds like we specifically wanted to try to use the WebView to download the image, but we are using the main frame to download an image which could be from a child frame.<span class="line"><!---->Eugene, Mark, Justin: As reviewers of the "Copy Image" feature, how should we handle this case. It sounds like we specifically wanted to try to use the WebView to download the image, but we are using the main frame to download an image which could be from a child frame.<!----></span><br><br>I can think of a few mitigations:<span class="line"><!---->I can think of a few mitigations:<!----></span><br>1. Fix/sanitize the URL before handing it to the main frame. I am not sure if this is trivial or not.<span class="line"><!---->1. Fix/sanitize the URL before handing it to the main frame. I am not sure if this is trivial or not.<!----></span><br>2. Download the image in the same WebFrame which the element exists. This would require some feature changes as the WebFrame isn't available right now to ImageFetchTabHelper.<span class="line"><!---->2. Download the image in the same WebFrame which the element exists. This would require some feature changes as the WebFrame isn't available right now to ImageFetchTabHelper.<!----></span><br>3. Remove this download method. There are still two other ways to get the image - draw it into a canvas or download outside of WKWebView.<span class="line"><!---->3. Remove this download method. There are still two other ways to get the image - draw it into a canvas or download outside of WKWebView.<!----></span><br>4. Send the image data with the initial context menu element details instead of the URL. There is already a 100ms timeout since this method is only meant to retrieve the image from cache, not actually re-download so I think this wouldn't create any noticeable delay, but would increase the size of the context menu payload for images significantly and it gets called a lot (on every tap/scroll down).<span class="line"><!---->4. Send the image data with the initial context menu element details instead of the URL. There is already a 100ms timeout since this method is only meant to retrieve the image from cache, not actually re-download so I think this wouldn't create any noticeable delay, but would increase the size of the context menu payload for images significantly and it gets called a lot (on every tap/scroll down).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I uploaded a CL is escape the URL here:<span class="line"><!---->I uploaded a CL is escape the URL here:<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/2628024<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2628024"><!---->crrev.com/c/2628024<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> This won't prevent the leaking of the URL. Migrating image fetch JS to isolated worlds would mitigate the leaking of the URL, but running the JS within the same frame as the image (instead of just the same WebView) would be even better.<span class="line"><!----> This won't prevent the leaking of the URL. Migrating image fetch JS to isolated worlds would mitigate the leaking of the URL, but running the JS within the same frame as the image (instead of just the same WebView) would be even better.<!----></span><br><br>I suggest we proceed in this way:<span class="line"><!---->I suggest we proceed in this way:<!----></span><br>- Land URL escaping CL<span class="line"><!---->- Land URL escaping CL<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/crrev.com/c/2628024<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/crrev.com/c/2628024"><!---->crrev.com/crrev.com/c/2628024<!----></a> and merge to M89<span class="line"><!----> and merge to M89<!----></span><br>- Migrate image_fetch.js to isolated world, target M90<span class="line"><!---->- Migrate image_fetch.js to isolated world, target M90<!----></span><br>- Then optionally (but it will improve the success of fetching images via canvas drawing or cache hits) update code to call getImageData on the WebFrame which the image resides in. The WebFrame id is returned with the context menu message, but the WebFrame is not currently piped through the context menu action sheet to the ImageFetch code.<span class="line"><!---->- Then optionally (but it will improve the success of fetching images via canvas drawing or cache hits) update code to call getImageData on the WebFrame which the image resides in. The WebFrame id is returned with the context menu message, but the WebFrame is not currently piped through the context menu action sheet to the ImageFetch code.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          margin: 0;

        }

        mr-edit-issue {

        }
      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        Convert issue to new template structure<h3 class="medium-heading">Convert issue to new template structure</h3>
        
          
            Pick a template: <label for="templateInput">Pick a template: </label>
            
              --Please choose a project template--<option value="">--Please choose a project template--</option>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }

            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;

 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }

 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
